content: 1 k 14 16 18 ssk k1 turn row 2 sl 1 p 3 p2tog p1 turn row 3 s1 1 k to 1 st before gap ssk k1 turn row 4 sl 1 p to 1 st before gap p2tog p1 turn *do not sl first stitch on very last purl row you will purl it repeat row 3 and 4 until all stitches on the heel have been worked you will end with a wrong side row and have 16 18 20 sts left now it is time to pick up gusset stitches gusset k across the first 8 9 10 stitches of the heel turn and place a marker this will now be the beginning of your round k across the last 8 9 10 stitches of the heel turn and then pick up 14 16 18 stitches along the side of the heel flap pick up 1 extra stitch in the ladder in the row below k across the instep stitches front of the sock being sure to stay in pattern pick up 1 extra stitch in the ladder in the row below pick up 14 16 18 stitches along the side of the heel flap and then knit across to the marker you will now begin decreasing by repeating the following two row until you are back down to your original stitch count of 56 64 72 make sure that you are staying in pattern for the instep stitches the sole of the sock will be in plain stockinette round 1 k to 3 sts before the instep begins k2tog k1 knit across instep in pattern k1 ssk knit to end of round round 2 k all sts once you are back to your original count continue knitting the foot until the foot length measures 1 5 1 75 2 inches shorter than your desired length then continue on to instructions for the toe the austin socks -- crazy sock lady designs -- kay litton -- not for commercial use for help or questions please email kay at crazysockladydesigns@gmail com 5 toe following are instructions for a basic rounded toe this is my favorite way to do toes on my socks you can of course feel free to substitute and use your favorite toe round 1 k to 3 sts before instep k2tog k 1 k1 ssk k to last 3 sts of instep k2tog k1 k1 ssk k to end of round round 2 k all sts repeat round 1 and 2 until 28 32 36 stitches remain repeat round 1 until 16 stitches remain use kitchener stitch to graft the stitches together and close up the toe *there are a lot of wonderful tutorials on youtube on how to do kitchener stitch ok now you are halfway done hurry up and cast on that 2nd sock before you get distracted  the austin socks -- crazy sock lady designs -- kay litton -- not for commercial use for help or questions please email
